intro: Monolena trichopoda, commonly known as the hairy white sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and dense, grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects. Monolena trichopoda is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and resilience.
